business.headline: India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

Radhika Gupta on market volatility: Bad times don't last. Good investors doRadhika Gupta's advice comes as stock markets continue to witness a downward trend, with the sell-off in smallcap and midcap stocks intensifying.

Senco Gold share price tumbles 32% in 2 sessions. Here's what brokerages saySenco Gold stock price: The sell-off started on February 14 after the company reported its quarterly numbers showing profits plunged 69.3% to Rs 33.48 crore compared to Rs 109.32 crore a year ago.

Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

Should you avoid smallcap, midcap stocks amid ongoing market correction?One of the primary reasons behind this downturn is the steep valuations of smallcap and midcap stocks, which analysts believe had reached unsustainable levels.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.
Sensex, Nifty fall as market sell-off continues; Mahindra shares fall 4% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 458.91 points to 75,480.30, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 145.70 points to 22,783.55 as of 9:42 AM.

New Income Tax bill: What is tax year? How is it different from assessment year?The new bill aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act and one of the key changes introduced in the New Income Tax Bill, 2025, pertains to the concept of the 'tax year.'

Hexaware Technologies IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and GMPHexaware Technologies IPO Allotment: Investors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status online through the registrar, KFin Technologies, or via the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website.
India-Israel free trade deal on the cards: What it means for both nationsA group of over 100 Israeli companies visited India, and held more than 600 business meetings with Indian business leaders.

India slashes import duty on bourbon whisky to 100% after Trump's criticismThe reduction in customs duty on bourbon whisky was notified on February 13 just ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's talks with US President Donald Trump.

entertainment.headline: Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

general news.headline: New crowd control plan after Delhi stampede: Focus on 60 stations, use of AIDays after a stampede killed 18 people at the New Delhi railway station, the Centre has introduced a new crowd control plan, including the creation of permanent holding zones at 60 high-traffic stations, sources told India Today TV.

Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

Delhi quake: Government warns of possible aftershocks, PM's 'stay calm' appealPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday urged the residents of Delhi-NCR region to stay calm and follow safety protocols in case of possible aftershocks following a 4.0 magnitude earthquake in the national capital.

Gaffe machine Sam Pitroda says China issue 'blown out of proportion', blames USDuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last week, US President Donald Trump offered to mediate in the India-China border dispute. The offer was, however, rejected, with Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri saying New Delhi would approach a bilateral approach.

Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb act in Chhaava: Internet says actor is back and howChhaava: The internet cannot get enough of Akshaye Khanna's performance as Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. Apart from Akshaye, the film also stars Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna in pivotal roles.

Maharashtra Cyber Cell orders Samay Raina to appear in person on TuesdayThe Maharashtra Cyber Cell has directed YouTuber Samay Raina to appear in person on February 18 to record his statement regarding the obscene remarks row on the now-deleted show India's Got Latent.

Pandya bros ate just Maggi, Bumrah spoke to the ball: Nita Ambani on MI scoutingIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

4.0 magnitude earthquake jolts Delhi-NCR out of sleep, big tremors, rumbling noiseA 4.0 magnitude earthquake hit Delhi-NCR early on Monday with its epicentre in the national capital. The tremors lasted for a few seconds and caused panic among residents.

Video: Meet Trump's special guest at Daytona 500, his granddaughter CarolinaCarolina, adorable in a white frock and a 'Make America Great Again' cap, was photographed with her "grandpa", US President Donald Trump, at the event.

What EVM data Supreme Court doesn't want Election Commission to eraseThe court directed the poll panel not to erase or reload EVM data for scrutiny, questioning its SOPs and Rs 40,000 fee. The panel must clarify before the March hearing

The state of the mob and the failure of the stateAt the New Delhi railway station on Saturday night, a "sea of humanity" travelling for a Kumbh dip was waiting for the train to Prayagraj. A platform-change announcement triggered a tsunami in that sea. Faith, fate, and a whole lot of frantic feet. India has a mob problem.

Delhi Chief Minister's oath on February 20 at 4.30 pm after BJP meet: SourcesOut of 48 BJP legislators who won in the recently-concluded Delhi Assembly elections, 15 names have been shortlisted -- nine will be selected for key posts of the Chief Minister, state cabinet ministers and the Speaker -- according to sources.

Milind Deora's special message for Maharashtra student who went paragliding to collegeSamarth Mahangade, a student from Pasarani Village in Wai taluka, took the bold step when he found himself stuck in traffic just minutes before his exam.

Why Delhi's 4.0 earthquake felt stronger than it wasStrong tremors jolted Delhi-NCR residents out of sleep on Monday morning due to a 4.0 magnitude earthquake that shook buildings and left people terrified. But, was the earthquake as strong as it felt?

Ex-poll body chief Quraishi denies US funding claim for voter turnout in IndiaFormer CEC SY Quraishi rejected DOGE's claim of granting funds for boosting voter turnout in India and termed the reports baseless.

Tharoor 'surprised' by backlash over article praising Kerala's industrial policyCongress MP Shashi Tharoor defended his article praising Kerala's startup growth, calling the controversy "surprising." He clarified that his intent was not to assess Kerala's overall economy but to highlight changes in the state's business environment, which was initiated by the late Oommen Chandy.

Prateik's wife on Raj Babbar's absence from wedding: All who mattered were thereActor Prateik Babbar married Priya Banerjee in an intimate ceremony but didn't invite father Raj Babbar. Priya said everyone who mattered to them and who they consider as family were a part of the celebration.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.

Mumbai bank scam: Employee reveals how RBI uncovered Rs 122 crore cash shortfallA routine audit at New India Cooperative Bank uncovered a Rs 122-crore cash shortfall. A senior bank employee's statement, accessed by India Today TV, revealed how RBI officials detected and confronted the massive financial discrepancy.

Delhi earthquake: What made the rumbling sounds beneath your feetEarthquake in Delhi: The earthquake's epicentre was located in Delhi, at a shallow depth of only 5 km. This shallow origin likely intensified the tremors felt across the region.

India Art Fair: Is social media turning art into a mainstream sensation? India Art Fair's latest edition was sold out. Was it just social media outreach playing its part, or were genuine art connoisseurs, in larger numbers, filling the void?

PM adviser calls USAID 'biggest scam' as DOGE cuts India's 'voter turnout' fundsOn Sunday, the Elon Musk-led Department of Government Efficiency announced that it had slashed $723 million in foreign aid funding, including a $21 million to increase "voter turnout" in India.

Man trying to exit station due to overcrowding lost 7-year-old in Delhi stampedeSeven-year-old Riya was among the 18 people killed in the stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on Saturday. She was trying to leave the station with her parents after they decided to call off their journey due to the rush.

Goa man sent to life in jail for 2017 rape-murder of Irish-British touristAfter a lengthy trial of eight years, the Margao Principal District and Sessions Court held Vikat Bhagat guilty of the rape-murder of the 28-year-old Irish-British tourist, sentencing the 31-year-old to life in prison.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Sanam Teri Kasam box office Day 10: Harshvardhan's film beats Tumbbad re-releaseSanam Teri Kasam is ruling the box office and how. Nine years after its release, the heartbreaking romantic film, starring Harshvardhan Rane and Mawrah Hocane is creating waves at the Indian box office.

Karan Johar says SS Rajamouli's films lack 'logic': You only see convictionIn an interview recently, Karan Johar took an example of SS Rajamouli's work, and shared that he has made successful films even when his stories lack logic.

Sivakarthikeyan, Murugadoss's film titled Madharasi, 1st look outTamil superstar Sivakarthikeyan's upcoming film with director AR Murugadoss has been titled Madharasi. The announcement was made by the latter on the actor's 39th birthday, accompanied by the film's first-look poster.

sports.headline: Mohammed Shami can carry India's attack in Bumrah's absence: Laxmipathy BalajiFormer pacer Laxmipathy Balaji feels that Mohammed Shami could be the leader of the Indian bowling attack during Jasprit Bumrah's absence at the Champions Trophy. Shami made his return to international cricket during the England T20I series.

My PR is my cricket: Ajinkya Rahane targets return to Indian Test teamRanji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane is aiming for a comeback into the Indian Test team as he feels there is cricket left in him. Rahane last played for India in Tests during the West Indies tour in 2023.

Not dissimilar to Jasprit Bumrah: Ex-captain defends Aussie spinner's bowling actionFormer Australia captain Tim Paine jumped to the defence of Matt Kuhnemann, claiming that the spinner has a similar action to that of Jasprit Bumrah. Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

When Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah's heroics shocked New ZealandChampions Trophy: Back in 2017, Bangladesh recorded a famous win against New Zealand after Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah's heroic 224-run partnership at the Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

India to win Champions Trophy, Rohit Sharma highest run-getter: Michael ClarkeChampions Trophy 2025: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke feels that Rohit Sharma will be the highest run-getter in this year's Champions Trophy. James Maddison earns Tottenham 1-0 victory over Manchester UnitedTottenham Hotspur midfielder James Maddison starred with an early goal against Manchester United which helped his team register a 1-0 victory in the Premier League on Sunday, February 16.

Champions Trophy 2025: India to play on fresh pitches in Dubai The Indian cricket team is set to play their matches of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on two fresh pitches in Dubai specially kept aside for the tournament.

WPL 2025: Priya Mishra, Gardner guide Gujarat to 1st win of season vs UP WarriorzGujarat Giants registered their first win of the season as they beat UP Warriorz in the third match of the Women's Premier League 2025. Ashleigh Gardner was once again top scorer for Gujarat.

Carlos Alcaraz reacts to Jannik Sinner's doping settlement, eyes No. 1 spotWhile Jannik Sinner's agreement with the World Anti-Doping Agency for a reduced doping ban has created a stir in the tennis community, Carlos Alcaraz seemed uninterested in the debate surrounding his arch-rival.

Rishabh Pant was hit by a shot from Hardik Pandya but recovered quickly after being attended by the team's physio.

IPL 2025 schedule announced: 13 venues, 12 double-headers in new seasonA total of 13 venues will be used for the new season of the IPL in 2025 as the tournament starts on March 22. The 2025 season will see 12 double headers take place as the 10 teams battle it out for the title.

Watch: India suffer injury scare as Pant gets hit on his knee during practiceIndia wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant was seen in excruciating pain after being hit on his knee during the team's first practice session in Dubai.

IPL schedule: KKR vs RCB in opener on March 22, final in Kolkata on May 25IPL 2025: The BCCI announced the full schedule for the new season. KKR will take on RCB in the opening match on March 22 while the final will be in Kolkata on May 25. A total of 13 venues to host 74 matches in the 2025 season.

Pakistan get big Champions Trophy boost as star pacer cleared for opener: ReportPakistan have received a big boost ahead of their Champions Trophy 2025 opening match against New Zealand as star pacer Haris Rauf has been cleared for the match. Rauf was injured during the recent tri-series.

India vs Pakistan is overhyped: Harbhajan sends Champions Trophy warning to fans Champions Trophy 2025: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh cautioned fans against expecting a close contest in the India vs Pakistan match, predicting a one-sided victory for Rohit Sharma's side.

Pakistan cricket team is like their country, both go up and down: Aakash ChopraFormer India cricketer turned commentator has compared the Pakistan cricket team's inconsistency with their country, mentioning how both have a volatile nature.

Premier League: Manchester United confirm injury blow for forward Amad DialloManchester United have confirmed that Amad Diallo will be out of action for several weeks after sustaining an ankle injury during training. Amad will miss United's away trip to Tottenham Hotspur on Sunday, February 16,

Extra tickets for India vs Pakistan match in Dubai sold out within hoursChampions Trophy 2025: The ICC announced the sale of additional tickets for India's matches in Dubai on February 16. The India vs Pakistan tickets were gone in hours.

Watch: New Zealand's Williamson spotted wearing a dhoti in KarachiKane Williamson delighted fans by embracing local culture in Karachi, donning a traditional dhoti ahead of New Zealand's Champions Trophy opener clash against hosts Pakistan on February 19.

Tim Southee delighted with Kane Williamson's comeback ahead of Champions TrophyFormer New Zealand cricketer Tim Southee praised Kane Williamson on his remarkable comeback to ODI cricket ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Jannik Sinner doping ban: Daniil Medvedev hopes everyone can negotiate dealDaniil Medvedev is hoping that Jannik Sinner's deal with the World Anti-Doping Agency will set a precedent going forward. Medvedev hopes that other players will be given the chance to negotiate similar deals.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
